page.title: 19Local Walks 3 and 4
page.content: WEST DEAN TO PRESTON FARM. The walk starts from village and procedes through a plantation with evidence of forestry industry.It then continues through cultivated land including maize,corn,grass and wheat.Preston farm is mainly arable but it also uses its fields for dairy farming,and sheep-rearing.The old Midhurst to Chichester railway line runs through this farms property. BOTTOM BARN TO WEST DEAN FARM. The fields north of Preston farm are cultivated.Bottom barn is reasonably large and has farming machinery such as Harvesters and Tractors.Haslers Steading is a group of farm buildings complete with a disused sheep dip and stables.On the way back to West Dean farm the Trundle can be seen.
